newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds firm in late trading.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds firm in late trading.

text.p: Argentine bonds erased slim losses and stood firm in late trading Monday, soothed by a partial recovery in U.S. Treasuries, dealers said.
"There was very little activity today, and all we saw were speculators tracking movements in the U.S. long bond yield," one trader said.
Argentina's FRB Brady bond due 2005 rose 1/4 to 94 while the dollar-denominated Bocon Previsional 2 due 2001 added $0.05 to 121.1.
"People are waiting to see what the U.S. Federal Reserve decides between tomorrow and Wednesday, although most analysts have ruled out an interest rate hike," another dealer said.
She said market players were basically "calm" but had moved to the sidelines ahead of the Fed meeting.
